result.execSummary:
The defendant Bonnie J. Emerich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture or Deliver Prescription Drug [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(9)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the 2 or if not perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization of agent.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample.
NO days jail credit at this time-may be addressed at a later date. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Getzin - $546.00
(full amount of bill paid by the County and assessment added to case)
(copy to party)
and Reimbursement to County - dated 4/13/15
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:31 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Gerhardt Getzin.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Deliver Prescription Drug/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization of agent; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; DNA sample; court costs. 
Atty Getzin makes statement regarding complicated nature of jail credit. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked at this time - notes issue of jail credit may be addressed at later date if needed. 
Adj: 10:44 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:47 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Gerhardt Getzin. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information to be filed this afternoon. 
COURT sets calendar call on 2/18/2015 at 1pm to set arraignment. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 10:49 am
Gary Getzin

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:11am
Dft. Appears.

Court questions Dft. RE: Employment/Income.


Court appts Atty Gary Getzin @ $70/hr. not to exceed amount as listed in order, w/o further order of the Court.
To be repaid at $25/month 

 
C: Br. 3
Indigency hearing on January 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing on February 16, 2015 at 10:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 02:50 pm.
No prescription drugs w/o valid prescription.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
